page.title: 02WOODLAND SURVEY
page.content: The woodland is at grid ref 119232 on the map of Alnwick and Rothbury.The name of the wood is{Bilton Wood}which was planted by{Capability Brown}in the 19th Century.The plants are of a mixed variety mostly grasses because of the shade.The trees are dominantly Beech with the exception of Sycamore,Oak and Ash.We think that most of the trees are roughly about one Century old because they are very tall and thick. The shrubs therefore are really quite young apart from a few exceptions.The varieties are Gorse,Broom,Elderberry, Hawthorn and Brambles.The flowering plants are the Red Campion,Nettles,Cow Parsley,Coltsfoot,Dock and Yarrow.The non-flowering plants are quite dull as they consist of lichens,moss,fern, large variety of fungi and mould.
